It means you can connect to the hotels WiFi service for free and then pay for Internet usage. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Everyone that I encountered spoke perfect English. The area is great if you are driving or walking. The hotel does not have parking but there are places to park within a few minutes walk (very expensive) and you are right between two Metro stations. Just north of the hotel is a great shopping area where you can find all sorts of food shops and restaurants. You are also a ten minute walk from the Opera and the major department stores. As long as their rates stay reasonable, Hotel Jules will get my business.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SethC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a quick trip to Paris. The room was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. The room was small by American standards but reasonable by European standards and larger than many rooms in which I have stayed in Paris. Hotel staff were friendly, efficient and accommodating. English was spoken fluently. Hotel is walking distance to everywhere and located very near Gare du Nord. I would absolutely recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel value and great location in Paris - no question.”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravel321
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently stayed in paris for 3 nights. We searched for hotels on tripadvisor and felt like the vast majority of the places we read about had extremely negative reviews (room is tiny, dirty, staff rude, won't provide towels, etc), so we were a bit anxious about booking a place. We found hotel jules and the reviews seemed fairly favorable, and the price was right ( ~165 a night). We definitely made the right decision. The hotel is very modern, clean and tourist friendly. The staff went out of their way to help us, even though we barely speak any french ( we did make an effort though). The room was small by american standards, but it provided all that we needed. Any it truly was smoke free. The bathroom was modern and clean and we had a nice view out the front of the building towards the city. They have a computer available for internet access, which we found very helpful as we were traveling with out cell phones. They also have a small room with a treadmill and exercise bike. I wouldn't call it a gym, but it was nice to be able to do something aerobic for a few minutes each day. The computer/internet did charge by the minute (a fair price) and the gym was free. The hotel also served a free breakfast each day. I'm not sure if it was free for everyone or just part of the deal we signed up for when we booked. The breakfast was more than adequate. Plenty of choices, hot and cold. We're not extremely picky when it comes to free food. I figured if we didn't like it, we'd just go somwhere else. The location is great too. We walked almost everywhere once we figured out there were a few different routes we could take. The louvre was about a 15-20 minute walk. The opera area was about a 10 minute walk. I think we even walked to notre dame, although that was a bit further. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the area, so there was always something to do, and it felt very safe. So, all in all, I would definitely stay here again if we were heading back to paris, especially knowing there are a lot of places which may not live up to expectations. One other tip, non-hotel related. While the metro/subway is a very good way to get around, we had some problems with it. First, the machine for purchasing tickets does not take paper cash, only the euro coins. Which, when we exchanged money or went to the ATM, we basically only received cash. So, you'll have to ask for the coins specifically. Also, while the ticket machine did take credit card, it only works with the cards that have a chip built into it. I think its a new european standard that hasn't quite caught on in the states yet. None of my cards, nor my fiance's have a chip in them, thus they didn't work. It was extremely frustrating for a while trying to figure out why our cards wouldn't work at the metro stations. At first we just thought it was a bad machine, but after it kept happening everywhere, we knew it was us. Luckily a very helpful passer-by stopped to ask if we needed help and filled us in on the whole chip thing. So, good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Jules is a real jewel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jolyncar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jules is in a great location just 15 min walk from Eurostar terminal and 15 min walk from the Louvre. The hotel is very modern with great design and the rooms are lovely. They are a good size, although not huge, but a comfortable size and again decorated really well, they are scrupulously clean and in great condition. They have some really nice design features. The staff are lovely and speak English and I can't recommend them enough. Breakfast is ok at the hotel but don't expect too much. On the whole a really great hotel to stay in the centre of Paris. From my parents room on the 5th floor they had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower which they were very pleased about. My partner and I are quite fussy about where we choose to stay and this hotel met all of our expectations. My boyfriend said it was the one of the best hotels he has stayed and he's an interior designer. So high praise indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: phil_bridge
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Paris and again TripAdvisor helped in our choice of hotel, we were not disappointed with “Jules” for our 3 night stay from the 18th May, it’s in a great location, very clean room and bathroom, good breakfast and helpful staff, 2 minutes from the metro, what more do you need when you are sightseeing in Paris, we spend as little time as possible in the hotel (you can’t see Paris from a hotel room), we booked through Expedia and got 3 nights for the price of 2 with breakfast, total price £325 not bad for Paris. Also if you ask at reception they will supply you with a kettle and cups for making your own tea and coffee at no cost. Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: GracieAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I wish I could write great words about our stay at Hotel Jules, but unfortunately it was nothing special. We had read great reviews on Tripadvisor, but were a little disappointed. After going back and forth through various websites we found a Superior Room with breakfast for 432euros for 3 nights. (this was a great deal compared to the first quote I found for over 700euros). We were given a tiny room in the roof, with just enough room at the bottom of the bed to walk by, a small bathroom – although sans bath and a tiny window that was tucked around the corner of the headboard so no full light in the room and we were unable to open fully for air. On our first day we asked for a change of room, but none were available. My sleep was interrupted by the whirring of the air-con. I tried to sleep with it off, but the heat was unbearable. I had to use my ear-plugs. As for the hotel bar, I don’t think it was open over our weekend, and we never made breakfast as it was downstairs in a cramped room. We decided we could get better food outside in the sunshine. The only positive being that the bed was really comfortable, fantastic location and the staff are really friendly. I’m sure there are other alternatives. I was quite happy to pay more, but got the fantastic deal and expected if I had of paid over 700euros we would have a better room and a hotel with a little personality. I had been recommended Hotel Amour just 5 mins walk away, but unfortunately it was full. Sorry Hotel Jules, but we won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “My thoughts changed after initially liking it.”
Reviews.Author: hans p
Reviews.Content: I was attracted to Hotel Jules with their special ,stay 2 nights the 3rd night is free as noted in the Wall Street Journal .I had been warned that to expect tiny rooms with tiny bathrooms .This was not the case ,the room was average size and the bathroom too .It was clean ,no complaint here .The breakfast was so so ,I couldn,t stand the looks of the scrambled eggs ,so I didn,t eat them .There are bagettes were you cut a piece for yourself ,I was struck that there was no napkin to hold the bread as you cut a piece off (I had a cold at the time )with everyone handling the bread that was not good .Hotel Jules is located in a so so neighborhood but with easy access to the Metro with through access to the Louvre .The thing that shook me up though was ,we had a power cut in our block around 4pm .The emergency lights came on in the hallways and stairways .We were on the second floor as I went down the emergency stairs I was stumbling all over the place ,the lights were too dim ,I completely missed the last step and almost went down.I insisted on a flash light from the front desk ,which they gave me .I asked ,is anyone on the elevators ,they answered they didn't know .Here is the problem ,unlike the USA ,when you have a power cut, in Paris ,you lose the phone service too (at least we did here)I went to our room to get my wife ,and then I noticed the shortcomings of this hotel and maybe Paris hotels too.No smoke detectors in the room ,no emergency lights in the room ,I could not see any sprinklers anywhere .The elevator sits in the middle of a long corridor with a stairway next to it .I don,t know if there was another emergency exit since everything was in French .I concluded that if there was a fire in this hotel at night ,I would be very lucky to get out ,and I was on the second floor ,there were at least 6 floors ,god knows what would happen to them .The power cut lasted 4 hours ,and I started to think how we take things for granted in the USA ,sprinklers and all the safety items that go with a US hotel .I don,t know if there is a fire code in France ,but this stay at Hotel Jules has me worried and I will pay attention to these fears next time I travel to Europe by checking safety items before I book .I do want to stress that many hotels are 100 years or more old and might be exempt from todays fire codes ,but that does not preclude you worrying and checking if the hotel is up to US code .I would also want to say that the Hotel Jules may be 1 of many hundreds of hotels in Europe that are not up to todays code ,and I'm not critisizing them ,just the Paris requirments for fire safety.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but bad breakfast service and bad air conditioner”
Reviews.Author: mack555
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 6 nights from 4th Apr to 10th Apr. It is located on Rue Lafayette which is not far away from EURO star station and which we can walk to the hotel in less than 10 mins (with our lauggages). Everything is great since we have booked our hotel during their promotion (107EUR/day with breakfast). Room is in average size in european standard and it is Clean. However i don't like the design in bathroom especially the shower area. Breakfast is FREE from our package but just don't refill the portion even we asked. Anyways, what can u expect for a FREE breakfast? At least they have enough coffee and juice which i'm already ok with that. Recommand to reserve the a room NOT facing Rue Lafayette cos' it is quite noisy @ night. With the bad air conditioner, u may need to open window to sleep in order to have a better air circulation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at Hotel Jules”
Reviews.Author: SunseekerScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April as a long weekend for my husband's birthday. Our room was clean but small. The bed was comfy and we were on the 5th floor with a balcony you could walk out on. The air con didn't seem to work very well and it was quite warm outside so we left the french doors open before going to sleep and early in the morning. Breakfast was tasty, but chaotic. There was a good choice of food, but it was very busy and items seemed to run out in an instant. The waiting staff, who were very good humoured were constantly being asked to replenish glasses, juice, cutlery etc but did it all with a smile and a bien sur. The croissants and pain au chocolats were declious. The hotel is in a good location wit a metro very close by and overall we had an extremely enjoyable stay and felt that the hotel was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: JuanHi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room at Jules hotel for two nigths just a week before eastern. Our expectation about a hotel in Paris was not particularly high (previous experience). Hotel Jules turned out to be very modern, staff was really friendly and helpful and everyone speaks english. Breakfast buffet was great. We had a really nice and quiet room towards the backyard. This hotel is located just next to Metro Le Peletier. It's close to all major attractions yet a quiet neighborhood. I can't think of anything we missed here. This small hotel gave us everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Stikling
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jules is a fantastic hotel at a reasonable price. Great value for money. Clean, recently refurbished rooms. Not big - but big enough. This hotel is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Jules, Paris What a Jewel”
Reviews.Author: HollyCorkIreland
Reviews.Content: Just back after 5 nights in Hotel Jules. Rue Layfaette. What a find.From check in from start to finish it was a lovely hotel. The rooms are quite spacious by Paris standards. Mini bar, tv. kettle, hairdryer it had it all. We got a terrific deal which included free breakfast, which was lovely. Scrambled egg, sausage, tomatoes and the usual cereals, juice, fruit, yogurt and lovely fresh crossiants. They are offering free breakfast up until May, which is a great deal. The only advice I would offer is, ask for a room at the back of the hotel. When window is opened at night, there is a bit of noise from the traffic. We requested a change, and there was no problem. I must say the hotel staff are most accommodating, and go out of their way to make your stay as stress free as possible. For that alone I would give Hotel Jules 10 out of 10. I would definately, stay there again. It is central, and has 2 metro stations, 3 mins away. Lovely restaurant accross the road. Au General is the name of that, and the food is excellent. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: April9X
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago, my best friend and I stayed at Hotel Jules for 6 nights. This was our first trip to Europe and to Paris, and neither of us spoke fluent French. I booked the hotel through Travelocity in a hotel+flight package. For a 3-star hotel, this place gave us everything we needed. Our room was a simple twin contemporary (non-smoking) on the 5th floor with a balcony, facing Rue Lafayette. This afforded us a great view of the top of the Eiffel Tower from a distance, especially when the tower was lit up at night. Anyways, below is a list (positives and negatives) about this hotel. I'll begin with the negatives because it's shorter. "Minor" Negatives: - Small room and small bathroom = The room is a standard European size, so it is smaller than an American hotel room. Fortunately for us, we were already prepared for the small size, so it wasn't a shocker. - Heater making noise = The heater in our room was loud; it sounded like a shower was turned on next door. After the first few nights, we stopped using it because the room remained warm as long as the balcony doors were shut. - Reception/lobby area undergoing renovations = Work occurred during the day, but we were rarely around to see it; by the time we got back from our Paris explorations, it would be night time. - Small elevator = Compared to an American-sized elevator, Hotel Jules' single elevator was small. However, it did have enough room to comfortably fit 4 people, or 2 people with luggage. Positives: - Location = The hotel is in a nicer area of Rue Lafayette. The street is not overly crowded/congested, and neither is it a truly quiet area. There is a small restaurant across the hotel with a green canopy (unfortunately we did not have a chance to eat there). There is also a small grocery store at the first left intersection from the hotel. Best of all, the hotel is located between 2 metro stops, Le Peletier and Cadet, both about a 1 minute walk away. Also the 2 big department stores, Galeries Lafayette and Au Printemps, are close by (just 5-10 minutes walk away). - "New" look = The hotel seems to be undergoing the last phases of its renovations to give it a more modern/contemporary look. - Very friendly and helpful staff = The front desk employees were very friendly throughout our stay. They wore business professional attire, spoke English, and were available 24 hours. They also accomodated our needs: a) David checked us in promptly when we arrived, and also helped us in translating some French phrases. b) One time we called down for some soap, and they delivered it to our room shortly after. c) When we needed a taxi to pick us up at the hotel and take us to the airport early the next morning, a front desk employee offered to call the taxi and make arrangements for us. Next day, check-out was a quick process, and the taxi showed up on time (6:00 in the early morning). - Guest room was always clean. The housekeeper came everyday. - The beds were simply AMAZING! = The sheets were so comfortable and soft we wanted to take them home with us. The beds were totally at fault for our lateness in getting up every morning. - Room amenities = There is an in-room safe, and a tea/coffee tray. The bathroom also had a strong hairdryer, which I desperately needed. The TV mostly had French channels, but there were also 2 English channels (CNN and BBC) and a channel for Spanish, German and Italian. - Balcony doors = These doors acted as a noise buffer to the street noise below us. Also, when shut, they kept the room warm. - Efficient check-out = Took less than 5 minutes. Since we didn't incur any extra charges during our stay, all I had to pay at check-out was the city tax (1 Euro per person per night). Overall, our stay at Hotel Jules was wonderful. We received the basic necessities, and the hotel atmosphere was friendly and welcoming. I wouldn't mind coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “More style than substance”
Reviews.Author: JohnJB
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jules is nicely positioned north of the city centre within a 5 minute walk of the two main department stores on Boulevard Haussman and fairly close to Gare du Nord. It's closest metro station will get you to the Louvre/Palais Royal within 5 minutes also. The hotel itself has been completely refurbished and is very tastefully decorated in a contemporary style throughout. Works are still going on in the reception area and there was a faint odour of fresh paint everywhere. As we visited the hotel with a view to organising a function in Paris we were able to inspect a standard room, a superior room, a deluxe room and a suite. The suite and the deluxe room were significantly larger than the other rooms and nicely finished - smart, spotless and stylish. The standard and superior rooms are similarly decorated but very small - no more than 4-5 paces square. Just enough room for a double bed and a dressing table. The bathrooms are brand new but also small. I would recommend insisting on a room overlooking the Rue Lafayette (the front of the hotel) and the internal view from the corridors is horrible. The only real problems with the hotel are easily solved by the management and astonishing that they still exist. They are that the shower room we occupied in our superior room was devoid of a working extractor fan and so fogged up instantly. The newly fitted shower enclosure was fine but there was no internal shelf upon which to place soap/shampoo etc. which meant having to repeatedly exit the enclosure to retrieve the essentials. The shower itself was unable to dispense more than a drizzle and the temperature of the water was totally uncontrollable, instantly changing from arctic to nuclear without warning. My wife's main gripe, however, was that the room's designer had completely neglected to install a mirror of any shape or size leaving her desperate and needing even longer to beautify herself. All in all this is a good choice of hotel for a flying visit to Paris and it's good value - we paid just over £100 per night. The best aspect is the fact that is is new and shiny as opposed to many other Parisien budget hotels. The undoubted style and design however is offset by the room size and absence of some basic facilities. Hopefully the hotel management will read this and attend to the niggles. If they do then this hotel would be very high on my list of places to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming yet small hotel”
Reviews.Author: demondmoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Jules for only two days. I extended my trip for two extra days beyond my other hotel booking (Marriot rive gauche hotel). The Jules is very charming and has the whole "modern/minimalist decor thing" going. Its in a very nice yet touristy area. The rates are reasonable and the staff is accommodating. The staff changed my room and even combined my 2 twin beds into a large king bed. The hotel has a nice view as the windows open up entirely and some rooms have a walk out balcony. there are many cafes and pharmacies within 2 block walking distance. Overall it was good, but I was only there for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Jules”
Reviews.Author: charmm
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about the Jules. We stayed in room 412, it was a bit small but had everthing we needed. The room has been renovated. We had a view onto Rue La Fayette which was great each morning to remind you that you were in Paris. The staff were always helpful and spoke very good English. I had phoned ahead that day to arrange a transfer and nothing was a problem for Claude and his team. Definitely would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Jules
HotelInfo.Address: 49-51 rue Lafayette | 09 Arr., 75009 Paris, France
